meanings.definition: Not honest or truthful; inclined to lie or deceive.
meanings.sent1: The dishonest man tried to cheat his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent2: It is wrong to be dishonest and not tell the truth.
meanings.sent3: The dishonest student pretended to be sick to avoid taking the test.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as dishonest as a broken promise.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest behavior left a stain on his reputation.

meanings.sent1: She showed her dishonest nature by stealing from her friends.
meanings.sent2: A person who is dishonest cannot be trusted.
meanings.sent3: The dishonest politician promised to lower taxes but raised them instead.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed as dishonest as a false friend.
meanings.sent5: His dishonest actions spoke louder than his empty words.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest salesman tricked customers into buying faulty products.
meanings.sent2: It is important to be cautious of dishonest schemes.
meanings.sent3: The dishonest magician made the rabbit disappear with a clever trick.
meanings.sent4: The mirror's reflection appeared dishonest in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest advertisement misled many consumers.
